title: Find and Replace
content:
Find and Replace # To perform a find-and-replace operation on a file using Vex, follow this syntax:
vex replace "foo:bar=input.txt" Explanation:
foo: The text you want to find. bar: The text you want to replace it with. input.txt: The file where the operation will be performed. This command follows the general format:
[find:replace=<textinput>] Case Sensitivity # By default, the replace command is case sensitive. To make it case insensitive, add the -i flag:
vex replace "foo:bar=input.txt" -i
